alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Perry and southwestern Breathitt Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bush Branch, or 12 miles northwest of Hazard, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lamont around 325 PM EDT. Watts around 330 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ned, Dice, Hardshell, Rowdy and Noble. THIS INCLUDES Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
